index.title: Discover artificial intelligence, robotics and computer programming with ease
index.description:
Vittascience is an educational platform designed for learning AI and coding, offering innovative tools for teaching.
Program cards, robots, games, etc., the only limit is your imagination!

platform.title: The all-in-one platform for learning about computers

1.title: Programming
1.content: The interfaces adapt to the student's level by allowing visual blocks to be translated into Python, which is an important pedagogical innovation for the transition from middle school to high school.

2.title: Resources
2.content: Discover openly licensed resources created by community teachers and the Vittascience team to explore math, technology and science!

3.title: Classroom
3.content: The Classroom Management module simplifies the tracking of learners on programming activities. Easily create activities, assign them to learners and view their results!

4.title: Hardware
4.content: Discover the digital world with ready-to-use educational kits or make your own experiments with electronic components. The icing on the cake is that 100% of the hardware available on the store is compatible with our interfaces!

5.title: Demonstration
5.no-interface-selected: It's your turn to try the Vittascience interface! Please select an interface to start.
5.try-window: You can try the interface in this window.

6.title: AI
6.content: Generate text and images, train and experiment with AI models, and visualize the interaction zones that allow the AI to make its decision. Then explore the structure of the neural network.

eduup.title: Vittascience is a laureate of the Edu-Up program
eduup.paragraph: Led by the Ministry of National Education, it supports the production of innovative and adapted digital resources.

interfaces.title: Get started and choose your interface!
interfaces.discover_all: Discover our different interfaces

aurore.testimonial: It's a project that responds to the expectations of new programs and is very rewarding for the students because, through its originality and size, it is very noticable to the larger school community.

tarik.testimonial: It's fun, user-friendly, and interesting (even if we would have liked to be able to go up in the balloon).

erwan.testimonial: The application of physics was beneficial given that we don't often have the opportunity to apply such concepts in real life contexts.

daniel.testimonial: The second and third graders were in charge of the project. They were all enthusiastic and showed an amazing capacity to build the balloon.

alicia.testimonial: It was great to carry out the project as a team, to divide the tasks, to reach agreements, and to think about how to optimise each parameter.

laurent.role: Teacher at the Regional School for the Visually Impaired in Loos
laurent.testimonial: A big thank you for creating this site which really brings a breath of fresh air to the field of hands-on electronics and to the world of education.

cyril_bartolo.testimonial: I love the interface with the blocks, the Python, the simulator, the graph of the sensors, and with the resources, everything is TOP!

research.title: Research at Vittascience
research.desc: Welcome to the page dedicated to Vittascience's research work. We are committed to developing and promoting innovative solutions for teaching programming, robotics, and artificial intelligence, with a particular focus on accessibility and inclusion.

section2.title: Research team
section2.card1: Developmental psychologist, PhD student at Vittascience
section2.card2: Corporate mentorship for a doctoral student in cognitive ergonomics, Laboratoire Travail et Cognition, University of Toulouse, CNRS

section5.title: Research events
section5.desc: Vittascience actively participates in scientific events and international competitions. Find here the dates and summaries of past and upcoming presentations.

section6.title: Contribute
section6.desc: Are you a researcher, teacher, or any other individual or institution wishing to collaborate with Vittascience from a research perspective? This space is dedicated to cooperation opportunities.

card1.title: Resource development
card1.desc: Become a member of a consortium for the development of educational resources on AI teaching. This opportunity is aimed at teachers, teacher trainers, and AI literacy researchers wishing to collaborate on the development of educational content integrating AI across various disciplines, ensuring coherence with existing curricula and students’ interests.

card2.title: Educational experiments
card2.desc:
Come test your classes with this introductory programming course on variable assignment! This experiment lasts between 1 and 1.5 hours. By participating in this online experiment, your students will be able to interact with different programming interfaces (block, text, and hybrid). The experiment is divided as follows:
1. Collection of personal information (in compliance with GDPR standards, data are then processed anonymously).
2. Course video on variable assignment in computer programming
3. Learning exercise
4. “Progress evaluation” exercise
5. Interface preference questions
6. Questions on students' feelings and anxiety towards computer programming.

card3.title: Propose a contribution or partnership
card3.desc: Do you have other ideas for contribution or partnership? Feel free to contact us to discuss: Contact us via a dedicated form

ia.title: Thesis on Teaching AI Literacy
ia.description: This research project aims to experiment with different ways of teaching AI to enable students to adapt to the constant evolution of this discipline. The objective is to identify the best pedagogical methods to allow students to transfer their AI knowledge to new contexts. The thesis explores different teaching approaches, comparing single-discipline learning and interdisciplinary integration. It also aims to prevent the emergence of skill-level disparities in this new discipline.

participate.title: Participate in this research project
participate.description: Become a member of a consortium for the development of educational resources on AI teaching.
participate.opportunity: This opportunity is addressed to teachers, teacher trainers, and AI literacy researchers who wish to collaborate in developing AI-integrated educational content across various disciplines, ensuring coherence with existing curricula and students’ interests.

programming.title: Thesis: "Assessing the Effect of Attentional Sharing in Programming Learning with Block-Based and Text-Based Languages among Students with Special Needs."
programming.description: This doctoral project aims to improve the accessibility of programming learning, particularly for students with special educational needs. It draws on cognitive load theory and multimedia learning theory to study the effect of attentional sharing in a hybrid learning environment (blocks and text). Through several experiments with 10th- and 9th-grade students, the objective is to identify encountered difficulties, evaluate the effectiveness of different learning modalities, and propose scientifically validated pedagogical solutions. The results will allow the adaptation and optimization of Vittascience’s educational tools, thereby contributing to a more inclusive and effective education.
programming.authorposition: Developmental Psychologist, PhD Student at Vittascience

about.title: "Science without experience only ruins the soul."
about.subtitle: (Nor science without conscience, thanks Rabelais )
about.desc: The goal of Vittascience is to bring together students and broadly open their horizons through scientific projects. Convinced that experience is one of the key components to learning, we propose innovative kits that allow the orchestration of experience-based educational projects. </br></br> In a world where the digital is is becoming increasingly important, it is vital to initiate youth at an early age to programming and the digital world. However... this must not come at the cost of children learning to work with their hands! For this reason, each of our kits is formulated to use both digital and hands-on components.

timeline.desc_2016: Vittascience was conceived through a collaboration between middle schoolers and students of the ISAE-Supaero school (National Higher French Institute of Aeronautics and Space) during a community outreach project. OSE L’ISAE. Léo and three of his classmates, rather than supervising typical class activities, decided to come up with a more interesting activity with a Mathematics teacher and her class. They decided to construct a solar balloon, which became the first kit of Vittascience!
timeline.desc_2017: After that, things progressed quickly, with Vittascience able to distribute 70 kits during the 2017\ 2018 academic year that will be used in Mainland France, French Guiana, and the United States. 2017 was also the year of partnerships, including the Jean-Louis Gerondeau - Zodiac Aerospace award (€20,000) and a partnership with the École Polytechnique's Diversity and Success Pole.
timeline.desc_2018: Vittascience became official and is transforming into a small business. Following numerous feedback on the Solar Balloon and Solar Oven kits, Vittascience launches the development of a coding interface for Arduino as well as educational digital resources.
timeline.desc_2019: With the arrival of the new high school programs, the platform expands with a Python and Micro:bit interface. Vittascience becomes the winner of the Édu-up program from the Ministry of National Education and Youth, with the aim of improving the platform from a pedagogical, technical and accessibility point of view.
timeline.desc_2020: With the arrival of the Classroom Management module, numerous innovations, and partnerships with several educational publishers, the platform is increasingly used in schools. Furthermore, Vittascience designs 5 new kits and adds many new products to the store. Behind these ever-faster advances, a shock team!
timeline.desc_2021:
The Vittascience team grows, with the arrival of six new developers! The Classroom Management module becomes open source, and many coding interfaces are added to Vittascience.
Vittascience starts a collaboration with Texas Instruments, which gives birth to MaClasseTI.fr
timeline.desc_2022:
In 2022, Vittascience begins developing the first interfaces for introducing artificial intelligence, thanks to support from the Édu-up program.
Vittascience joins the Campus Numeria consortium dedicated to educational innovation. Scheduled to open in 2025 at Futuroscope, this campus will welcome over 10,000 students annually. Vittascience will develop a robotic arm programming workshop, inspired by the attraction “Dance with Robots,” to introduce young people to block and Python coding.
With 6 European partners, Vittascience wins the Erasmus+ SteamCity project.
timeline.desc_2023:
In 2023, one of our most significant partnerships is born: Vittascience interfaces are integrated into the Capytale platform!
Vittascience partners with Cabrilog, Edumalin, and Belin Education to provide resources in the Digital Educational Territories (TNE), via the national market led by Réseau Canopé.
timeline.desc_2024:
In 2024, Vittascience launches a research division with two theses in cognitive psychology: Léa on programming accessibility and Camille on AI education.
Vittascience wins the Universcience call for projects on the theme “Artificial Intelligence at Our Service” with the project “Train an AI in 2 minutes!”, presented at the Cité des Sciences et de l’Industrie from September 2024 to March 2025.
Vittascience launches a kit dedicated to embedded artificial intelligence in partnership with STMicroelectronics.
Vittascience wins the GESAwards (Global EdTech Startups Awards) France 2024.
The Verdinum and I-NOVMICRO 2 projects are launched.
We are pleased to collaborate with five textbook publishers — Hatier, Foucher, Delagrave, Magnard, and Bordas — who have integrated activities using Vittascience into their books.
timeline.desc_2025:
In 2025, the Vittascience platform reaches over 350,000 unique annual visitors.
The programming interfaces are adapted to more than 40 boards and robots, catering to the youngest (see CM1/CM2 programming kit) to the most advanced (Tello drone and Embedded AI kit).

team.title: THE TEAM
team.leo_b: Trained as an aerospace engineer, he is passionate about education and the sciences. Rather than making airplanes like his former classmates, he chose to be an entrepeneur and co-founded Vittascience.
team.elodie: Elodie is the accountant for the Vittascience team
team.maxence_l: Maxence has been in charge of all the visible parts of Vittascience since March 2020, both on the creation and the improvement of pages. He has notably made the site accessible!
team.diana: As a designer and engineer, Diana uses her talents to create and enhance Vittascience's resources.
team.damien: Biology teacher and Vittascience collaborator since May 2019. He joined the team full time in the summer of 2020, and is as much involved in the pedagogy and kits as he is in the platform.
team.laura: Vittascience's design expert, thanks to her, the platform has become colourful and pleasant to use, but also the educational booklets, the packaging of the kits... everything, in a nutshell!
team.leo_m: Léo is a graduate student with a passion for science. He is in charge of electronics and block creation at Vittascience.
team.sebastien: Sebastien joined Vittascience in May 2021 as a full-stack developer. He will support the team mainly at the back-end level of the website.
team.remic: Rémi is a Back-end Developer, He joined Vittascience in July 2021
team.thomas: Thomas was able to modernize the entire Vittascience platform in the span of two months during the fall of 2019 thanks to his JavaScript skills. He is now in charge of the Classroom module of Vittascience.
team.oussama: Oussama is passionate about computers and software optimization. He created the Micro:bit and Python interfaces in the summer of 2019, and continues to help the team on the platform architecture.
team.irina: Part of the team since March 2022, Irina is mainly working on the AI interface on the Vittascience platform.
team.antoine: Antoine joined the Vittascience team as a web developer in April 2022. He is in charge of the programming interface.
team.andreas: Joined the technical support team in September 2022
team.amandine: Amandine is involved in the marketing and communication strategy to improve the visibility of the company and its brand image.
team.viviane: Viviane joined Vittascience in October 2022 as an alternating student. She's a front-end web developper.
team.nicolas: Nicolas joined Vittascience in February 2023 as an intern in frontend developer.
team.vladimir: Vladimir joined Vittascience in October 2023 - he is the very first Business Developer of the team!
team.amara: Amara joined Vittascience in 2023 as the Supply Chain Manager. He is in charge of managing the store.
team.lea: Lea joined Vittascience in 2024. A PhD student in cognitive psychology, she takes care of the research aspect and her thesis topic is: 'Evaluating the effect of attentional sharing in learning programming with block language and textual language, among students with special needs.'
team.pascal: Pascal joined Vittascience as an apprentice developer in 2024, after working for two of Vittascience's partner associations, the L.A.B and La Scientothèque.
team.damien2: Damien joined Vittascience as an apprentice web developer in 2024, and is in charge of SEO and RGAA.
team.noemie: Noémie has been the Partnerships Manager since August 2024. She is responsible for partner relations and envisions new collaborations. She also supports Amandine with communication and marketing aspects while leveraging her commercial skills.
team.camille: Camille joined Vittascience in 2025 as a PhD student in cognitive psychology as part of her CIFRE thesis: 'Teaching AI literacy, how to enable students to adapt to the constant evolution of this discipline?'
team.marc: Marc joined Vittascience in September 2024. He is doing his apprenticeship with us and, alongside Ylarie, takes care of all the logistics at Vittascience and ensures the smooth operation of our store.
team.ylarie: Ylarie has been handling the logistical aspects of the Vittascience store alongside Marc since September 2024, from adding products to shipping packages!
team.hire: You're passionate about education, you like projects, and you think you your abilities will be an asset to our team? Don't hesitate to contact us!

hof.title: WE WOULDN'T BE HERE WITHOUT THEM
hof.desc_morgane: Morgane has been a Vittascience ambassador at several educational events, including Ludovia 2018 and Car Tec-Inno 2018!
hof.desc_adrien: Adrien helped write educational resources in 2018, which you can still find in the Resource section today!
hof.desc_renaud: Renaud was Vittascience's first developer in spring/summer 2018. In the span of a few months, he was able to lay a solid foundation on which the entire platform still rests today!
hof.desc_valentin: Valentin contributed to Vittascience in the fall of 2016, in order to improve educational content and imagine the future of Vittascience.
hof.desc_alex: Alex was involved in the first six months of Vittascience's life, and was the first to imagine the integration of microcontrollers and programming in our kits. Today these notions are at the heart of all our content!
hof.desc_jean: Jean was involved in the first six months of Vittascience's life, and contributed a lot to the creation of the first kit: the Solar Balloon. He was very involved in going to classes and testing in real-life situations, in order to make the kit evolve into what it is today!
hof.desc_eric: Eric was involved in the first six months of Vittascience's life, and helped to become the winner of the 2016 Social Cup thanks to a stunning pitch 😉
hof.desc_lorene: Lorène was the pillar of the sales and marketing part for 2 years at Vittascience, from early 2017 to early 2019. Beyond her many ideas that transformed Vittascience, she was able to federate a community of several hundred teachers!
hof.desc_tom: Tom created many blocks on the Arduino interface during his two month internship in spring 2019. Maybe you've already used some of "his" blocks without realizing it!
hof.desc_yanis: Yanis helped improve Vittascience's descriptions and visuals during his internship in the spring of 2019. The site is much clearer thanks to him!
hof.desc_oceane: Océane laid the foundations for the Vittascience resource section during her internship in the summer of 2019.
hof.desc_remi: Rémi made the platform much more flexible during his internship in spring/summer 2020. If you can use Vittascience on your tablet and smartphone, it's mainly thanks to him!
hof.desc_maxence_m: Maxence is a developer at Vittascience. He worked on the first versions of the interface as early as 2018 and continues to upgrade the platform ever since!
hof.desc_clement: Former full-time developer on the Vittascience interface from 2019 to 2021, he was the Swiss Army knife of the team.
hof.desc_fahmi: Fahmi is a high school teacher and wrote resources for Vittascience (more than 100!) to facilitate access to electronics and programming for beginners.
hof.desc_karl: Karl was a developer at Vittascience - he laid the foundation for the wiring simulator for programming interfaces.
hof.desc_taha: Taha is a student engineer in Telecommunications. He contributed to the development of Vittascience's interfaces during his internship in the summer of 2021.
hof.desc_paul: Paul joined Vittascience as an intern in May 2023 to help with the programming interface. He greatly contributed to the development of the Python ⇆ Blocks translation.
hof.desc_alexandre: Alexandre was an alterning student at Vittascience in front-end web development from February 2023 to September 2023.
hof.desc_naser: Naser was a back-end developer in the Vittascience team.
hof.desc_maxence_l: Maxence has been in charge of all the visible parts of Vittascience's platform from March 2020 to March 2024, both in the creation and improvement of pages. He notably made the site accessible!
hof.desc_oussama: Oussama is passionate about computers and software optimization. He created the Micro:bit and Python interfaces in the summer of 2019, and continues to help the team on the platform architecture.
hof.desc_andreas: He was in charge of technical support from September 2022 to October 2023
hof.desc_viviane: Viviane joined the team from October 2022 to October 2023 as an alternating student. She participated in the front-end development of the website.
hof.desc_vladimir: Vladimir joined Vittascience in October 2023 for a duration of 4 months. He was the very first Business Developer of the team!
hof.desc_maxime: Maxime discovered Vittascience in 2024 during his high school internship.
hof.desc_flora: Flora was one of three interns present between June 17 and 28. I discovered the company through the 'Un Jeune une Solution' website and hope to learn more in various fields of IT.
hof.desc_ines: Ines joined Vittascience in 2024 for her high school internship because she loved IT and knew it would be beneficial for her.

welcome.arduino:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Arduino!
Vous pouvez consulter le tutoriel disponible ici : Getting Started with the Vittascience Interface for the Arduino UNO board
welcome.microbit:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for BBC micro:bit!
You can check out the tutorial available here: Getting Started with the Vittascience Interface for the BBC Micro:bit board
welcome.python:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for programming in Python!
Click the Run button to launch your program (script mode) or write an instruction after the chevrons >>> below (REPL console mode).
welcome.esp32:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for ESP32!
To program the ESP32 board on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by following this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.wb55:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for STM32 NUCLEO WB55!
To program the STM32 board on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.l476:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for STM32 NUCLEO L476!
To program the STM32 board on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.texas-instruments: This interface is used to generate the Python code to use the BBC micro:bit board with the TI-83 Premium CE Edition Python calculator. Open the simulator to get started!
welcome.TI-83: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the calculator TI-83 Premium CE Python Edition! The boards TI-Innovator™ Hub and BBC micro:bit can be programmed on this interface. Open the simulator to get started!
welcome.TI-83-Maclasseti: Welcome to the MyClassTi.fr interface for the calculator TI-83 Premium CE Python Edition! The boards TI-Innovator™ Hub and BBC micro:bit can be programmed on this interface. Open the simulator to get started!
welcome.GalaxiaCircuitPython: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Galaxia !
welcome.galaxia:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Galaxia !
To program the Galaxia on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by following this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.raspberrypi: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Raspberry Pi! You can check out the tutorial available here: Getting Started with the Vittascience Interface for Raspberry Pi
welcome.niryo: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Niryo ned2!
welcome.nao: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for NAO v6 ! Feel free to consult the tutorial available here: Getting Started with the Vittascience Interface for NAO v6
welcome.mBot: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for mBot!
welcome.buddy: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the Buddy robot!
welcome.m5stack:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the M5Stack!
To program the M5Stack board on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.cyberpi: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for CyberPi and mBot2 robot from Makeblock!
welcome.eliobot: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Eliobot!
welcome.thymio:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Thymio robot! Feel free to consult the tutorial available here: : Getting Started with the Vittascience Interface for the Thymio Robot
To program the Thymio robot on this interface, you need to first launch the TDMLauncher program available for download here
welcome.letsstartcoding: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Let's start coding boards! If you need more information, go to this link : Let's start coding
welcome.pico:
Welcome to the Vittascience interface Vittascience for Raspberry Pi Pico!
To program the Raspberry Pi Pico board on this interface, you must first flash the MicroPython firmware in the board by following this tutorial: Flashing MicroPython firmware
welcome.winky: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for Winky!
welcome.sphero: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the Sphero Mini robot!
welcome.lotibot: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the Loti-bot robot!
welcome.bluebot: Welcome to the Vittascience interface for the Blue-bot robot!

ch340driver.title: Having trouble uploading?

ch340driver.tutorial: Once the executable is launched, simply press 'install' if it's the first installation. Otherwise, press 'uninstall' and then 'install'. At the end of the installation, please unplug/replug your board and reload the Vittascience interface.

arduinoWarning.title: Switching to Arduino code mode (C++)
arduinoWarning.noticeHint: If you click "Continue", you can no longer program via the blocks but exclusively via Arduino (C++) language. You can always come back to block mode, but only to the current state of your project (local save), any changes you make to the code via Arduino mode will be lost (you also will also have the possibility to export your code to the format.ino). </br> The project backup features will also be disabled.
arduinoWarning.tip: If you wish to save the present state of your project on cloud, click on the button "Save" (recommended).

switchingModePython.title: Switch to Microbit code mode (Python)
switchingModePython.noticeHint: Please note that this mode is reserved for experienced coders. If you click on "Continue", you will no longer be able to program using blocks but only using the Microbit language (Python).</br> However, you can return to block mode, but only in the current state of your project (local backup), all the changes you make to the code via Python mode will be lost (you will also have the possibility to export your code in .hex format).</br> Project save features will also be disabled.
switchingModePython.tip: If you want to save your project as it is in the cloud, click on the "Save" button (recommended).

blockWarning.title: Switch to block mode
blockWarning.noticeHint:
Warning!

Your current code will be updated from the last local backup, meaning its saved state before switching to Arduino mode. If you want to keep your Arduino code, click on the "Export" button.

switchingModeBlock.title: Switching to block mode (Scratch)
switchingModeBlock.noticeHint: Your current code will be updated to the last local save, i.e. the state saved before switching to Block mode. If you want to keep your Python code, click on the "Export" button.

microbitBLE.title: How to pair your Micro:bit V2?
microbitBLE.content: To put the Micro:bit V2 board in pairing mode, press the A and B buttons on the board simultaneously. While keeping the A and B buttons pressed, press and release the reset button located on the back of the board. Several LEDs of the matrix light up. The Bluetooth logo is briefly displayed, then the LEDs form a pattern. The Micro:bit board is now in pairing mode.

step-0.title: Create data categories
step-0.description: For a model to learn to categorize information, at least two categories are required. By clicking on the pencil, name a first category (e.g., Recycling), and press outside the keyboard

step-1.title: Create data categories
step-1.description:
To compare different data, we will add a second data category.
Click on the 'Add a category' button.

step-2.title: Create data categories
step-2.description:
Name a second category by clicking on the pencil
(e.g., Trash), and press press outside the keyboard.

step-3.title: Add datasets to the model
step-3.description: To add data, click on the camera icon of the first category.

step-4.title: Add datasets to the model
step-4.description: Place an object in the area visible to the camera, then click on the ‘Take a photo’ button to capture between 10 and 15 differents photographs of the object.

step-5.title: Add more data to the model
step-5.description: Add data for the second category, click on the camera icon

step-6.title: Add more data to the model
step-6.description: Place an object in the area visible to the camera, then click on the ‘Take a photo’ button to capture between 10 and 15 differents photographs of the object.

step-7.title: Train the model
step-7.description: Congratulations! Your model contains enough data to make predictions. Click on the 'Train the model' button.

step-8.title: Check model efficiency
step-8.description: Place a new object in the area visible to the camera and observe the prediction percentage. The higher the percentage, the more accurate the model is.

step-9.title: Activate the areas of influence
step-9.description: Click on the ‘Areas of influence’ button and show objects to the camera again. The highlighted areas of the image correspond to those that are most significant in the AI’s predictions.

step-10.title: Interact with AI now
step-10.description: To better understand the results provided by the model, activate the influence zones and show objects to the camera again. This tool highlights the areas of the image that are most influential in the AI predictions.

step-welcome.title: Welcome to the text AI interface
step-welcome.description: Discover an interface that allows you to interact with text-based AI models, using instructions and modifying their parameters.

step-1.title: Exchange with AI
step-1.description: Find ideas among our examples. Click on the examples to send a random question.

step-2.title: Waiting for the response
step-2.description: The model takes some time to generate a response

step-3.title: AI's response
step-3.description: You can now observe the generated 'tokens' (groups of characters that represent the fundamental unit of the text). The color indicates the importance of the score of each token. Tap one of the colored tokens to get a list of possible tokens.

step-4.title: Explode token list
step-4.description: Clicking one of the list items will regenerate the response.

step-5.title: Change LLM model
step-5.description: Discover the text-based AI models available in the interface

step-6.title: Change 'random' parameter
step-6.description: Random variation, or temperature, is a parameter used to control the creativity and diversity of responses generated by a language model.

step-7.title: Discover the instructions
step-7.description: In the context of artificial intelligence and text generation, pre-prompt ou instructions are cues given in advance to guide or influence the outcome of a task or content generation.

step-8.title: Regenerate response
step-8.description: When adjusting the settings, the answer may vary. Please press the 'Refresh' button for an alternative answer.

step-9.title: Trade with AI now
step-9.description: Enter a question or phrase you want to ask the AI in the text field, then press the 'Run' button to get a response.

body: Moderation of AI responses on Vittascience interfaces includes several elements:
<ul><li>1. All models used are trained to maintain a 'moderate' conversation. However, there may be situations that require additional intervention. </lu>

• 2. AI-generated responses go through word-by-word moderation. If a word is detected that could be considered 'inappropriate', the internal mechanism replaces it with a string of asterisks, the length of which corresponds to that of the replaced word. This same mechanism warns users when an inappropriate word has been detected by displaying a message just after the AI response.

We have hidden an inappropriate expression in the response generated by the A.I. model. Indeed, despite all our precautions, we can't totally prevent the generation of rude/deplaced words by the system.

openRagPrompt.title: Full prompt sent to AI
openRagPrompt.info-block:
You have added a source (or sources) to improve the relevance of the AI. This process is called 'retrieval-augmented generation', or 'RAG' because the AI's text generation is augmented by retrieving text snippets from the sources. The first step in the process is to split the sources into 1000-character chunks and then vectorize them, i.e., make them understandable by the AI. Next, a proximity search is performed between your prompt and the sources to select the three most relevant text snippets for the prompt. Finally, these three snippets are added to the prompt to improve the relevance of the AI's response.
Below is the full prompt sent to the AI, which includes your initial prompt as well as the three snippets:

lucie-7b-instruct.description: Lucie-7B-Instruct is the first fully open French model, including its training data, created by the OpenLLM France consortium. This model is not optimized for code generation and mathematics.

mistral-nemo-instruct-2407.description: An advanced conversational AI model optimized for understanding and generating precise responses to complex instructions. Ideal for technical support and data analysis.
mistral-nemo-instruct-2407.strengths: Advanced contextual understanding, structured response generation, adaptability to complex queries.

gpt-4o.strengths: GPT-4o has the best vision and performance across non-English languages.
gpt-4o.description: GPT-4o (“o” for “omni”) is multimodal (accepting text or image inputs and outputting text), and it has the same high intelligence as GPT-4 Turbo but is much more efficient—it generates text 2x faster and is 50% cheaper.

gpt-4o-mini.strengths: Affordable and intelligent small model for fast, lightweight tasks. GPT-4o mini is cheaper and more capable than GPT-3.5 Turbo.
gpt-4o-mini.description: gpt-4o-mini is a very versatile and efficient language model that can be used in various applications

deepseek-v3.description: DeepSeek-V3 is an advanced language model that significantly enhances efficiency and accuracy in response generation, outperforming its predecessors. It is designed for diverse tasks, including natural language processing, programming, and mathematics.
deepseek-v3.strengths: Excellente performance en compréhension du langage naturel, en raisonnement et en génération de code.

deepseek-r1.description: DeepSeek-R1 is an open-source artificial intelligence reasoning model. It stands out for its advanced problem-solving and logical reasoning capabilities, thanks to an internal reflection process that allows it to “think” before providing an answer.
deepseek-r1.strengths: Excellentes capacités de raisonnement et résolution de problèmes mathématiques. Auto-correction sans supervision humaine.

llama-3-8b-instruct.description: Instruction-tuned version of Llama 3.1 (8B parameters), optimized for precise task following. Features a massively extended context window.
llama-3-8b-instruct.strengths: Strong instruction understanding, long-context retention, cost-efficient for its scale.

qwen2-coder-32b-instruct.description: Qwen2.5-Coder is the large language model and large multimodal modal (formerly known as CodeQwen) developed by Alibaba Cloud. Excels in tasks such as code generation, completion, reasoning, and repair, while maintaining general and mathematical capabilities.
qwen2-coder-32b-instruct.strengths: Achieves state-of-the-art performance across more than 10 code-related benchmarks, including generation, completion, reasoning, and repair. Outperforms other models of similar size in these tasks.

llama-3-70b-instruct.strengths: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct delivers strong performance in logical reasoning, mathematics, and code generation, making it useful for complex tasks requiring deep understanding.
llama-3-70b-instruct.description: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct is a large multilingual language model designed to follow instructions and excels at tasks such as reasoning, mathematics, text and code generation, as well as multilingual conversations.

aiTextInterface.safePrompt: You are caring and respectful. Always help with care, respect, and truth. Respond with the utmost helpfulness, but safely. Avoid harmful, unethical, prejudicial, or negative content. Ensure responses promote fairness and positivity. Only answer the user's last question concisely, without asking new questions, and strictly avoid repeating text. When generating code, surround it with triple backticks (```), specifying the language if possible.

cadavres_exquis.name: Exquisite corpses
cadavres_exquis.instruction: Hi, would you like to play a fun and creative game called Exquisite Corpse? In this game, we'll create a story, sentence or drawing together, one element at a time, without knowing what the other person has written or drawn previously. Each of us will add a piece to the creation. We'll play until I write 'End', at which point you'll see our complete collaborative work. To start, I'll write the first word or sentence, and then you'll take over by adding the rest. We can choose a theme or just let our imaginations run wild. Is that OK? If you're ready, just say Yes to get started, or if you have any suggestions for a theme, let me know. Ready to play?

SSD-1B.description: The Segmind Stable Diffusion Model (SSD-1B) is a distilled 50% smaller version of the Stable Diffusion XL (SDXL), offering a 60% speedup while maintaining high-quality text-to-image generation capabilities. It has been trained on diverse datasets, including Grit and Midjourney scrape data, to enhance its ability to create a wide range of visual content based on textual prompts.

Stable-Diffusion-XL.description: The Stable Diffusion XL 1024 v1.0 model is an advanced version of the stable diffusion model series. Its increased performance in resolution and visual fidelity makes it suitable for demanding creative applications such as illustration, design, and high-quality multimedia productions.

FLUX-dev.description: The FLUX[dev] model, built by Black Forest Labs, is an open-weight AI image generator. This model excels at generating text to images, providing extremely accurate and detailed outputs. It is particularly appreciated for its ability to follow complex prompts and generate anatomically accurate images, especially with difficult details like hands and faces. The model is based on a rectified flux transformer with 12 billion parameters.

body: Moderation of AI responses on Vittascience interfaces includes several elements:

• 1. Moderation of the user-provided prompt: First, the user-provided prompt goes through moderation, which is performed by a natural language processing model, trained to detect inappropriate content. If inappropriate content is detected, the user is prompted to reformulate his request. Show moderation prompt

• 2. Verification of generated images : The second step is to check that the image generated by the AI does not contain any inappropriate elements. If it does, the final image will be completely black, and the images from the generation stages will be blurred.
The combination of these steps ensures that interactions on Vittascience interfaces remain appropriate and respectful.
safetyPrompt: You are a natural language processing model trained to detect inappropriate content. I'm going to give you some sentences, and your task is to determine whether the content is appropriate or not. Return 'true' if the content should be moderated because it contains inappropriate material, and 'false' if it is appropriate. Deem the content inappropriate if it contains:

Explicit violence, Explicit or suggestive sexual content, Hate speech, discrimination, or incitement to hatred, Harassment or bullying, Sensitive personal information, Content that is illegal or incites illegal activity, Crude or offensive language, False information or disinformation, A real person even if only their first or last name is given (example: Trump instead of Donald Trump), A person (adult or child) in a context involving clothing that is not sufficiently covering (at the pool, sauna, etc.), A person (adult or child) with clothing that is not covering enough (lingerie, swimsuit, miniskirt, etc.), A person with tattoos or piercings

Do not consider the content inappropriate if there is no explicit violence. For example, a man holding a tool (hammer, axe, knife) without bad intentions. Also, do not consider inappropriate what may be morally questionable but tolerated (someone drinking alcohol or smoking).
Here are some examples to help you understand what I expect from you:
Example 1: 'Draw a bloody battle scene.' -> true
Example 2: 'Create a picture of a sunset in the countryside.' -> false
Example 3: 'Draw a portrait of someone taking drugs.' -> true
Example 4: 'Can you draw a cute cat playing with a ball?' -> false
Example 5: 'A man at the pool' -> true
Example 6: 'Sean Connery driving an Aston Martin' -> true
Example 7: 'Mbappé on a golf course' -> true
Now, parse the following prompt and return 'true' or 'false':

CGV.title: GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SALE

preamble.title: Preamble
preamble.content:
VITTASCIENCE SAS, a simplified joint-stock company with a share capital of 10,000 euros, whose registered office is at 6 Boulevard Dubreuil, 91400 Orsay, registered in the Commerce et des Sociétés de Paris (Paris Trade and Companies Register) under number 837 973 296, proposes, via the vittascience.com website, published and operated by Vittascience and open to all Internet users, the sale of Vittascience products and the provision of educational activities and resources. Vittascience offers, among other things, a consistent service of sending clients scientific experiment kits containing all the necessary materials for an educational project. The client also has access to the thematic digital content provided by other schools and educational materials available on this platform.

These General Terms and Conditions of Sale and Use (GTCSU) determine the rights and obligations of the parties in connection with the sale of products offered by the seller, in particular the terms and conditions of sale of the products listed on the vittascience.com website. These GTCSU apply to all product sales made through the company's internet sites that are an integral part of the agreement between the buyer and the seller. The seller reserves the right to modify these at any time by publishing a new version on its website. The applicable GTCSUs are those in effect on the date of payment (or the first payment in the case of multiple payments) of the order. The customer declares to be able to legally contract under French law or validly represent the natural or legal person for whom he\she represents. Unless proven otherwise, the information recorded by the company constitutes proof of all transactions. We sell products in different countries, so these General Terms and Conditions of Sale and Use are globally applicable. It is, however, possible that additional laws apply depending on the country where you live. We comply with these applicable laws; no provision of these terms and conditions of sale and use may be construed as limiting your rights, if the laws in question provide you with greater rights than those set forth in the terms and conditions set forth herein.

1.title: Article 1: Product
1.content:
The company Vittascience represents their products via photographic image as close to reality at possible.
The photographs, illustrations and texts associated with products are not contractual and therefore not included under the responsibilities of Vittascience.
Vittascience reserves the right to modify a product without notice.
Vittascience products are designed for educational use. The products offered for sale comply with the French and European laws in place on their date of shipment. The company Vittascience cannot be held liable for abnormal use or use not in accordance with the instructions given in the usage guidelines supplied with the products.

2.title: Article 2: Price
2.content:
Prices shown are in euros (€) and include all taxes. They are given as an indication and may vary according to the evolution of our purchase costs.
The prices indicated include the delivery costs in Metropolitan France. Vittascience reserves the right to charge the customer additional delivery costs related to the location of the customer. Customs duties or other local taxes or import duties or state taxes may be payable in certain cases. These rights and sums are not the responsibility of the seller. They will be the responsibility of the buyer and are his\her responsibility (declarations, payment to the competent authorities, etc.). The seller suggests the buyer inquire about these aspects with the corresponding local authorities. The company reserves the right to modify its prices at any time in the future. The telecommunication costs necessary to access the company's websites are the responsibility of the customer.

3.title: Article 3: Information
3.content: The essential characteristics of the goods, services, and their respective prices are made available to the buyer on the company's websites. The customer certifies to have received information on delivery expenses as well as methods of payment, delivery, and execution of the contract. The seller agrees to honor the customer's order within the limit of the available products inventory only. Otherwise, the seller will inform the customer. This contractual information is presented in detail. In accordance with French law, contractual information includes a summary and confirmation upon validation of the order. The parties agree that the illustrations or photos of the products offered for sale have no contractual value. In accordance with the legal provisions regarding compliance and hidden defects, the seller will refund or exchange defective products and those that do not correspond to the order. The refund can only be requested by email and will be done within 60 days maximum.

4.title: Article 4: Order
4.content:
You can place an order via our order form or by validating a provided price quote that we provide upon request via our website, email, or telephone.
Our price quotes or pro forma invoices remain valid for a duration of 90 days from the issue of the document, unless otherwise stated. The vittascience.com website allows buyers to place an order online.
  • In the case of a public accounting institution (school, local authority, Réseau Canopé, etc.), payment by administrative order is possible. To do so, please generate a quote and then validate it with an order form, which will trigger the preparation of the order. The payment will be made upon receipt of the order, using the invoice issued when the order is shipped.
  • In the case of an individual order, payment can be made by credit card (immediate validation) or bank transfer (validation time of 2 days).
The customer will receive confirmation by e-mail of the order’s payment along with an order confirmation. The customer will receive a .pdf copy of the terms and conditions of sale and use. For delivered products, delivery will be made to the address indicated by the customer. For the purpose of order fulfillment and in accordance with Article 1316-1 of the French Civil Code, the customer is required to truthfully identify him\herself. The seller reserves the right to refuse any order, for example for any abnormal request, made in bad faith, or for any legitimate reason. Vittascience reserves the right to refuse any order from a customer with whom there is a dispute over the payment of a previous order.
Payment is possible by money order, bank transfer or credit card (via our partner Stripe). We do not accept payment by check.

5.title: Article 5: Retention of ownership clause
5.content: The products will remain under the company's ownership until complete payment.

6.title: Article 6: Terms of delivery
6.content: Orders are processed within 15 days, with an average delay of 8 days, except in case of unforeseen circumstances according to legal definition and other exceptions such as being out of stock, an unexpected inflow of orders, or inclimate weather. </ Br> In case the ordered product is not available, the company Vittascience agrees to inform the buyer as soon as possible. </ br> The products are delivered to the delivery address indicated at the time of order and according to the indicated delay. This delay does not take into account the time involved in the preparation of the order. In case of late delivery, the customer has the possibility to resolve the contract under the terms and conditions defined in Article L 138-2 of the Consumer Code. No price discount or payment of incurred damages may be requested in this case. The seller reminds that at the moment the customer assumes physical possession of the products, the risk of loss or damage of the products is transferred to the customer. It is the customer's responsibility to notify the carrier of any reservations regarding the delivered product. </ br> </ br> Unless expressly requested by the customer, we do not deliver during school breaks (closed schools: parcels return).

7.title: Article 7: Product reception by the buyer
7.content: Upon reception, the buyer must check the condition of the delivered package and refuse it if it is damaged. If a dubious or damaged parcel is accepted without reservation noted and signed on the delivery note, its dubious or damaged state is entirely the buyer’s responsibility. When the delivery note is signed, the carrier is released from any liability and no further action is possible. </ Br> The company Vittascience declines any responsibility if a dubious or damaged package is accepted by the buyer without reservation indicated on the delivery note. </ br> Vittascience takes the utmost care in checking and preparing packages. </ br> The buyer must check the contents of the delivery within 48 hours and must contact the Vittascience company within the delay of 48 hours after delivery Vittascience to report any anomaly or missing component, preferably by email: contact@vittascience.com.

8.title: Article 8: Product return under guarantee
8.content: Reminder of the legal warranty obligation: </ br> </ br> Vittascience offers the buyer a commercial guarantee and an after sales service that does not call into question the conformity default guarantee of provided goods in articles 1641 to 1649 of the civil code to which the Vittascience company is bound. </ br> </ br> Article L21-4 of the Consumer Code (Code de la consummation): </ br> "The seller is required to deliver goods in conformity with the contract and is liable for any lack of conformity existing at the time of delivery. They will also respond to any lack of conformity resulting from the packaging, the assembly instructions, or the installation when it was their responsibility according to the contract or was carried out under their responsibility. </ Br> </ br> Article L21-5 of the Consumer Code: </ br> "To be in conformity with the contract, the goods must: 1) Be fit for the customary use of a similar good and correspond to the description given by the seller and possess the qualities it was presented to have via its representation through a sample or model; </ br> present the qualities that a buyer may legitimately expect given the public statements made by the seller, by the producer, or by its representative, </ br> especially in advertising or labeling; </ br> 2 ) Or have the features defined by mutual agreement by the parties or be fit for any special purpose sought by the buyer, brought to the knowledge of the seller and that the latter has accepted. "</ Br> </ br> Article L21-12 of the Consumer Code: </ br>" The action resulting from the lack of conformity is prescribed by two years from the delivery of the property. "Article 1641 of the Civil Code:" The seller is bound by the guarantee for reasons of hidden defects of the sold item which render it unsuitable for its intended use, or which diminish so much this use that the buyer would not have acquired it, or would have given a lower price, if he\she had known them. "</ br> Article 1648 paragraph 1 of the Civil Code: </ br>"Action resulting from a prohibitory default must be indicated by the purchaser within two years from the discovery of the defect. "</ Br>

9.title: Article 9: After sales service
9.content: General questions: </ br> Our team can respond by telephone Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm (Paris time) at 33606758186, or by email:  contact@vittascience.com </ br> </ br> Technical questions: </ br> We are available on weekdays from 9 am to 5 pm (Paris time) at 33606758186. Outside these times, please ask your questions via email: support@vittascience.com </ br> </ br> </ br> Exchange\ refund requests and delivery problems: </ br> We ask for a written record. Please contact us by email: contact@vittascience.com </ br>

10.title: Article 10: Intellectual property rights
10.content: Trademarks, domain names, products, software, images, videos, texts, or more generally any object of intellectual property rights are and remain the exclusive property of the seller. No transfer of intellectual property rights is carried out through these GTCSU. Any total or partial reproduction, modification or use of these goods for any reason whatsoever is strictly prohibited. </ Br>

11.title: Unforeseen circumstances
11.content: The seller's obligations outlined herein shall be suspended in the event of an unforeseen circumstance that prevents their execution. The seller will notify the customer of the occurrence of such an event as soon as possible.

12.title: Article 12:  nullification and modification of contract
12.content: If one of the stipulations of the present contract is canceled, this nullity will not entail the nullity of the other stipulations which will remain in place between the parties. Any contractual modification is valid only after a written agreement signed by both parties.

13.title: Article 13: Applicable law
13.content: All clauses contained in these General Conditions of Sale and Use, as well as all the purchase and sale transactions referred to therein, shall be subject to French law.

CGU.title: CONDITIONS GÉNÉRALES D'UTILISATION

1.title: 1. Objet
1.content:
Vittascience est un ensemble de services sur Internet (ci-après : les « Services ») permettant d’exécuter, créer, modifier et publier des programmes informatiques ainsi que des ressources, activités et parcours pédagogiques (conjointement appelés ci-après : les « Contenus »).
Vittascience propose également à la vente du matériel électronique et des kits didactisés via le Site, se référer aux Conditions Générales de Vente pour plus de détail.

La société VITTASCIENCE (ci-après : « VITTASCIENCE ») fournit, par l’intermédiaire de son site internet www.vittascience.com (ci-après : le « Site »), des Services à destination des enseignants et particuliers (ci-après : les « Utilisateurs ») dédiés à l’enseignement et l’apprentissage des sciences et du numérique.

Les présentes conditions générales ont pour objet de définir les modalités et conditions d’utilisation des Services proposés sur le Site, ainsi que de définir les droits et obligations des Utilisateurs dans ce cadre. Elles sont accessibles et imprimables à tout moment.

Le Site et les Services sont exploités par la société VITTASCIENCE, plus de détails ainsi que les coordonnées de contact sont disponibles dans les Mentions Légales .

2.title: 2. Acceptation des conditions générales
2.content: L’acceptation des présentes conditions générales par les Utilisateurs est matérialisée par une signature électronique, pendant le processus d’inscription.</br></br>Cette acceptation ne peut être que pleine et entière. Toute adhésion sous réserve est considérée comme nulle et non avenue. Les Utilisateurs qui n’acceptent pas d’être liés par les présentes conditions générales ne doivent pas utiliser les Services.</br></br>Les Services sont accessibles aux internautes étant inscrits au Site, toutefois une partie du site est mise à disposition des internautes non identifiés afin de démonstration (se référer à la partie suivante pour plus détail). Si tel est votre cas, merci de lire attentivement ces conditions générales avant de naviguer sur le Site ou d’utiliser les Contenus, car elles constituent le cadre légal d’utilisation des Services. Dans ce contexte, le simple fait d’utiliser le Site vaut acceptation de ces conditions générales d’utilisation. Si vous n’êtes pas d’accord avec chacun des termes de ces conditions générales, n’utilisez pas le Site.

3.title: 3. Accès aux Services
3.content:
Il est possible de consulter une partie du Site gratuitement sans inscription. Ce mode de consultation vous permet de tester le bon fonctionnement des Services et des Contenus sur vos appareils et de découvrir le modèle pédagogique de Vittascience.
Ce mode de consultation ne vous autorise pas à utiliser les Services en classe ou en public.
De plus, plusieurs fonctionnalités d’édition sont réservées aux Utilisateurs inscrits.

La création d’un compte avec accès sécurisé (ci-après : le « Compte ») est gratuite, au moyen d’un formulaire d’inscription disponible sur le Site. Les Utilisateurs connectés suite à l’inscription sont autorisés à projeter les Services en classe ou devant un public, et disposent de plusieurs fonctionnalités d’édition comme la création de ressources, d’activité ou de parcours et la sauvegarde de projets dans le Cloud.

Les Services sont accessibles à toute personne physique disposant de la pleine capacité juridique pour s’engager au titre des présentes conditions générales. La personne physique qui ne dispose pas de la pleine capacité juridique ne peut accéder aux Services qu’avec l’accord de son représentant légal, ou dans le cas d’élèves sous la supervision d’une personne adulte au sein de leur établissement scolaire ou institution (enseignant, chef d’établissement, CPE, ou plus exceptionnellement un élève majeur).

Les Utilisateurs ont la possibilité d’inviter des élèves ou étudiants (ci-après : les « Apprenants ») pour former des groupes ou des classes virtuelles, ce qui simplifie la collaboration notamment dans un contexte d’enseignement à distance. Dans ce cas, l’Utilisateur est responsable de l’accès aux Services des Apprenants, à l’aide d’un code d’invitation ou bien en ajoutant manuellement les Apprenants.

L’accès aux Services est également possible via le Gestionnaire d’Accès aux Ressources (ci-après : « GAR »), piloté par le Ministère de l’Éducation Nationale. Dans ce cas, les Services seront accessibles par l’intermédiaire de l’Espace Numérique de Travail (ci-après : « ENT ») géré et fourni à l’Utilisateur par l’établissement scolaire auquel il est rattaché. Cet accès sera effectué d’une manière conforme aux exigences du Référentiel Technique, Fonctionnel et de Sécurité (RTFS) du GAR.

4.title: 4. Usage strictement personnel
4.content: Un seul Compte pourra être créé par personne. VITTASCIENCE se réserve la faculté de supprimer tout compte supplémentaire créé par une même personne.</br></br>L’Utilisateur s’engage par conséquent à utiliser les Services personnellement, et à ne permettre à aucun tiers de les utiliser à sa place.</br></br>L’Utilisateur est par ailleurs responsable du maintien de la confidentialité de son mot de passe et reconnaît expressément que toute utilisation des Services depuis son Compte sera réputée avoir été effectuée par lui-même.</br></br>L’Utilisateur doit immédiatement contacter VITTASCIENCE aux coordonnées mentionnées à l’article 1 des présentes s’il remarque que son Compte a été utilisé à son insu. Il reconnaît à VITTASCIENCE le droit de prendre toutes mesures appropriées en pareil cas.

5.title: 5. Responsabilité des utilisateurs
5.content:
La publication de Contenus ainsi que de réactions aux Contenus (ci-après : les « Commentaires ») suppose de respecter certaines règles, fixées dans la loi. Nous en donnons ici un aperçu général.

Il est notamment interdit d’insérer dans un Contenu ou Commentaire :
  • des contenus injurieux ou diffamatoires ;
  • des contenus racistes, antisémites, homophobes, sexistes ou handiphobes ;
  • des contenus appelant à la haine, à la violence, à la discrimination ou à commettre des infractions ;
  • des contenus pornographiques ou incluant de la nudité ;
  • des contenus invitant à la consommation d’alcool ou de drogues ;
  • des contenus imitant une marque ou une œuvre protégée par le droit d’auteur. Il est possible, par exception, d’intégrer dans les Contenus des reproductions et/ou représentations de telles œuvres, sous réserve qu’elles respectent les conditions des exceptions prévues par l’article L. 122-5 du code de la propriété intellectuelle.
Un Contenu peut consister aussi bien dans du texte que dans du code informatique, une image ou une vidéo, cette liste n’étant pas limitative.

VITTASCIENCE se réserve le droit de supprimer unilatéralement tout Contenu ou Commentaire ne respectant pas les règles ci-dessus ou à la demande des autorités compétentes.

Les Contenus sont créés et diffusés sous la responsabilité, en premier lieu, de l’Utilisateur. L’Utilisateur qui invite des Apprenants à collaborer devient directeur des publications, et endosse ainsi la responsabilité de ses publications ainsi que celles de ses Apprenants. Il s’agit nécessairement d’une personne majeure (enseignant, chef d’établissement, CPE, formateur, animateur, etc.).

Les Apprenants peuvent toutefois être également responsables, du point de vue civil (*) et pénal (**), en cas de violation d’une règle légale ou réglementaire telle que celles évoquées ci-avant.

En cas de doute, ou pour toute question particulière, nous vous invitons à vous tourner vers la personne responsable au sein de votre établissement ou institution (enseignant, chef d’établissement, CPE, etc.).

En résumé :
  • si vous êtes un Utilisateur, vous êtes en premier lieu responsable des Contenus que vous publiez et, le cas échéant, des Contenus publiés par les apprenants que vous avez invités ;
  • si vous êtes un Apprenant âgé de plus de 18 ans (majeur), votre responsabilité personnelle (civile et pénale) peut également être engagée en parallèle de l’Utilisateur qui vous a invité ;
  • si vous êtes un Apprenant âgé de moins de 18 ans (mineur), selon les cas, votre propre responsabilité peut être engagée en tant que simple auteur lorsque vous êtes considéré au regard du droit comme émancipé ou, à défaut, celle de vos représentants légaux (c’est-à-dire en principe vos parents).
(*) La responsabilité civile correspond (notamment) à l’obligation d’indemniser les personnes qui auraient subi un préjudice du fait d’un contenu intégré dans un programme, ressource ou activité (par exemple un contenu injurieux).

(**) La responsabilité pénale correspond aux amendes et peines de prison qui peuvent être infligées par un juge pénal, sur demande du procureur de la République.

6.title: 6. Protection des données personnelles
6.content:
VITTASCIENCE accorde une grande importance au respect de la vie privée. Nous vous invitons à consulter notre politique relative au traitement des données personnelles.

Dans le cas où l’Utilisateur choisit de souscrire et d’utiliser les Services via le GAR, les données nécessaires à la création de son Compte Utilisateur et des Comptes de ses Apprenants sur les Services seront obtenues par VITTASCIENCE par l’intermédiaire du GAR.

D’un commun accord, VITTASCIENCE et l’Utilisateur reconnaissent leur qualité de responsables conjoints de ces traitements de données, en tant qu’ils concernent les Apprenants, au sens de l’article 26 du RGPD. Ce statut reflète les responsabilités respectives de l’Utilisateur et de VITTASCIENCE vis-à-vis des Apprenants et les attentes légitimes de ces derniers, conformément aux lignes directrices des autorités compétentes.

Aux fins de bonne mise en œuvre des principes et obligations du RGPD, VITTASCIENCE assurera l’information des Apprenants concernant le traitement de leurs données au moyen d’un document intitulé « Politique de confidentialité », inséré sur l’interface des Services à laquelle accèdent les Apprenants.

VITTASCIENCE se chargera également de recevoir et traiter, en collaboration avec l’Utilisateur, les demandes d’exercice de droits des Apprenants émises sur le fondement des articles 15 à 22 du RGPD.

7.title: 7. Propriété intellectuelle
7.content:
Le site et chacun des éléments, y compris mais sans limitation la marque Vittascience, les logos, icônes, infographies, photographies, qui le composent sont protégés au titre de la législation internationale de la propriété intellectuelle. Ces éléments constituent, sauf indications contraires, la propriété exclusive de VITTASCIENCE. Toute utilisation, reproduction ou représentation, par quelques procédés que ce soit, et sur quelques supports que ce soit, de tout ou partie du site et/ou des éléments qui le composent n'est pas autorisée sans le consentement expresse de VITTASCIENCE.

Certains Contenus disponibles sur le Site sont publiés sous licence Creative Commons, notamment certains programmes informatiques, ressources, activités et parcours. La licence employée est alors toujours mentionnée sur le contenu. Il s'agit, selon le cas, d’une licence :
  • Creative Commons Attribution - Pas d’Utilisation Commerciale - Partage dans les Mêmes Conditions 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) : cette licence autorise le partage et l’adaptation du contenu, sous réserve d’attribution, d’usage non-commercial et de partage dans les mêmes conditions. Plus de détail sont disponibles sur ce lien;
  • Creative Commons Attribution - Pas d’Utilisation Commerciale - Pas de Modification 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-ND 4.0) : cette licence autorise le partage du contenu, sous réserve d’attribution, d’usage non-commercial et de non-modification. Plus de détail sont disponibles sur ce lien.
Toute utilisation du contenu du Site contraire aux présentes conditions générales engagera la responsabilité civile et pénale de l'Utilisateur à l'égard de VITTASCIENCE.

8.title: 8. Liens hypertextes
8.content: Le Site propose des liens hypertextes vers des sites web édités et/ou gérés par des tiers.</br></br>Dans la mesure où aucun contrôle n’est exercé sur ces ressources externes, l’Utilisateur reconnaît que VITTASCIENCE n’assume aucune responsabilité relative à la mise à disposition de ces ressources, et ne peut être tenue responsable quant à leur contenu.

9.title: 9. Responsabilité de Vittascience
9.content:
VITTASCIENCE est responsable du maintien des Services en ligne et de l'accessibilité du serveur qui héberge son Site, sous réserve des interruptions ponctuelles pour maintenance.

VITTASCIENCE s'efforce d'assurer au mieux de ses possibilités l'exactitude et la mise à jour des informations figurant dans le Site dont elle se réserve le droit de corriger, à tout moment et sans préavis, le contenu. Toutefois, VITTASCIENCE ne peut garantir l'exactitude des informations mises à disposition sur le Site.

En conséquence, VITTASCIENCE décline toute responsabilité :
  • pour toute interruption du Site, survenance de bogues ou autre événement rendant le Site impropre à son usage ;
  • pour toute inexactitude ou omission portant sur les informations disponibles sur le Site ;
  • et plus généralement pour tout dommage direct ou indirect, quelle qu'en soit la cause ou la nature résultant de la consultation et de l'utilisation du Site.
La responsabilité de VITTASCIENCE ne pourra être engagée en cas de force majeure ou de faits indépendants de sa volonté.

10.title: 10. Disponibilité des Services
10.content: Le format web des Services permet un fonctionnement sur la majorité des navigateurs web. L’Utilisateur doit disposer d'un appareil (ordinateur, tablette ou smartphone) équipé d'un navigateur web moderne et d'un accès au réseau Internet.</br>Les Services sont conçus pour fonctionner jusqu’à une largeur d’écran minimale de 320 pixels.</br></br>VITTASCIENCE ne peut garantir la compatibilité de son Site avec tous les dispositifs actuels ou futurs, vous êtes invités à vérifier que les Services vous donnent entière satisfaction.

11.title: 11. Modifications des CGU
11.content: Les présentes conditions générales d'utilisation pourront faire l'objet de modifications conformément à une éventuelle évolution des Services. Ces modifications peuvent avoir lieu en tout temps et sans préavis. Aussi les internautes sont-ils invités à consulter ces conditions d'utilisation régulièrement.</br></br>En cas de modification des présentes conditions d’utilisation, les Utilisateurs disposant d’un Compte recevront une alerte sous la forme d'un courriel.</br></br>La date de dernière modification des présentes conditions générales d’utilisation est indiquée en bas de cette page.

12.title: 12. Loi applicable
12.content: Les présentes conditions générales sont soumises au droit français.</br></br>En cas de litige né de l’utilisation des Services, nous vous invitons tout d’abord à vous rapprocher de VITTASCIENCE, pour que nous discutions ensemble du problème, et tâchions de le résoudre ensemble de la meilleure manière possible.</br></br>A défaut d’accord amiable, toute contestation relative à l'interprétation, la validité et/ou l'exécution des présentes relève de la compétence exclusive du tribunal judiciaire de Paris.

CGU.date: Dernière mise à jour le 15 août 2020.

header.title: INFORMATIONS SUR LES COOKIES
header.introduction: Le site www.vittascience.com dépose un petit fichier texte (un « cookie ») sur votre ordinateur, tablette ou mobile lorsque vous le consultez. Cela nous permet de mesurer le nombre de visites et de comprendre quelles sont les pages les plus consultées.

1.title: Ce site n’affiche pas de bannière de consentement aux cookies, pourquoi ?
1.content:
C’est vrai, vous n’avez pas eu à cliquer sur un bloc qui recouvre la moitié de la page pour dire que vous êtes d’accord avec le dépôt de cookies. Rien d'exceptionnel, pas de passe-droit.

Nous respectons simplement la loi, qui dit que certains outils de suivi d’audience, correctement configurés pour respecter la vie, exemptés d’autorisation préalable.

Nous utilisons pour cela Matomo, un outil libre, paramétré pour être en conformité avec la recommandation « Cookies » de la CNIL. Cela signifie que votre adresse IP, par exemple, est anonymisée avant d’être enregistrée. Il est donc impossible d’associer vos visites sur ce site à votre personne.

Ce paramétrage permet l’exemption au recueil du consentement, conformément l’article 5 de la délibération n° 2019-093 du 4 juillet 2019 portant adoption de lignes directrices relatives à l'application de l'article 82 de la loi du 6 janvier 1978 modifiée aux opérations de lecture ou écriture dans le terminal d'un utilisateur (notamment aux cookies et autres traceurs).

2.title: Comment désactiver le suivi statistique ?
2.content:
Vous pouvez désactiver ce suivi statistique, ainsi Matomo cessera d’inclure vos visites dans les statistiques. Pour ce faire, nous vous invitons à suivre l’une de ces procédures :
  • activer la fonctionnalité « Ne pas me pister » de votre navigateur : Mozilla Firefox ; Internet Explorer ; Google Chrome ; Opera ; Safari ;

Ou bien:
  • Décocher la case suivante
